channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: See you latte: Starbucks plans to cut 30% of its menu
item.description: Starbucks is trying to fix falling sales by changing its vibe back to coffee-house roots. The new CEO says parts of the plan, like free non-dairy milk, are helping bring people back.
item.content:encoded:
Starbucks is trying to fix falling sales by changing its vibe back to coffee-house roots. The new CEO says parts of the plan, like free non-dairy milk, are helping bring people back.

(Image credit: Godofredo A. Vásquez)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: NJ Attorney General joins suit to stop Trump's federal grant freeze
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin about his plans to block a federal funding freeze President Donald Trump ordered Monday.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin about his plans to block a federal funding freeze President Donald Trump ordered Monday.

(Image credit: MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Trump invites nearly all federal workers to quit now, get paid through September
item.description: Through an email blast, federal workers were given the opportunity to resign from their jobs before Feb. 6 and retain full pay and benefits through Sept. 30.
item.content:encoded:
Through an email blast, federal workers were given the opportunity to resign from their jobs before Feb. 6 and retain full pay and benefits through Sept. 30.

(Image credit: Tierney L. Cross)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Nearly 400 USAID contract employees laid off in wake of Trump's 'stop work' order
item.description: All departments were affected, including offices that address HIV and AIDS, infectious disease and child health.
item.content:encoded:
All departments were affected, including offices that address HIV and AIDS, infectious disease and child health.

(Image credit: J. David Ake/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Trump's 'stop-work' order for PEPFAR cuts off anti-HIV drugs for patients
item.description: As a result of the new administration's actions, health centers funded by PEPFAR, the U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief, are closing their doors and no longer dispersing medication.
item.content:encoded:
As a result of the new administration's actions, health centers funded by PEPFAR, the U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief, are closing their doors and no longer dispersing medication.

(Image credit: Foto24/Gallo Images via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Melody Schreiber

item.title: Caroline Kennedy calls her cousin, RFK, Jr., a 'predator' ahead of his confirmation hearings
item.description: In a letter, Kennedy said RFK Jr. was "unqualified" to be the new U.S. Department of Health and Human Services secretary just hours before he was scheduled to appear for confirmation hearings.
item.content:encoded:
In a letter, Kennedy said RFK Jr. was "unqualified" to be the new U.S. Department of Health and Human Services secretary just hours before he was scheduled to appear for confirmation hearings.

(Image credit: Michael Errey)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Trump has issued a number of orders affecting the military. Here's what they do
item.description: President Trump signed a number of new executive orders Monday night aimed at the U.S. military. Here is a breakdown of what he signed.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump signed a number of new executive orders Monday night aimed at the U.S. military. Here is a breakdown of what he signed.

(Image credit: Andrew Harrer)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Neymar leaves Saudi team to return to his first soccer club in Brazil
item.description: Neymar struggled through physical injuries for most of his time in the Middle East, with a previous ACL rupture that kept him sidelined for a year.
item.content:encoded:
Neymar struggled through physical injuries for most of his time in the Middle East, with a previous ACL rupture that kept him sidelined for a year.

(Image credit: Yasser Bakhsh)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: The Louvre will be renovated and the 'Mona Lisa' will have her own room
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron laid out an ambitious plan for a "reimagined, restored and expanded" Louvre. An art critic says Macron is aiming for another success after restoration of Notre Dame.
item.content:encoded:
French President Emmanuel Macron laid out an ambitious plan for a "reimagined, restored and expanded" Louvre. An art critic says Macron is aiming for another success after restoration of Notre Dame.

(Image credit: Bertrand Guay/Pool)
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: The company planning a successor to Concorde makes its first supersonic test
item.description: Denver-based Boom Technology's XB-1 demonstrator plane hit Mach 1.122 — 750 mph. It's the first independently developed supersonic jet. The company is also working on a supersonic passenger airliner.
item.content:encoded: Denver-based Boom Technology's XB-1 demonstrator plane hit Mach 1.122 — 750 mph. It's the first independently developed supersonic jet. The company is also working on a supersonic passenger airliner.
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
